definition: to collect money/to raise funds (for charity)
variant of 殮|殓[lian4]
to hold back/to restrain/to control (oneself)/to collect/Taiwan pr. [lian4]
surname Qian
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: he spent most of his life gathering money.
sentences.chinese: 他一生大部分的时间都用来聚敛钱财。

sentences.english: Forty years now they collected the money.
sentences.chinese: 他们聚敛钱财已经有40年了。

sentences.english: You have amassed wealth, but all of it is at risk.
sentences.chinese: 你有聚敛钱财，但它们全都是处于危险之中。

sentences.english: He spent most of his life to gathering money.
sentences.chinese: 他一生大部分的时间都用来聚敛钱财。

definition: to accumulate wealth/to rake in money
lit. to dredge for money/to make money by reprehensible means/to fish for a quick buck
to fabricate excuses (idiom)/to concoct various items (e.g. to pad an expense account)
to buy a title/to use wealth to acquire office
to swindle/to cheat
(coll.) to grab money/to rake in money
to gain from corrupt dealing/to engage in graft/to feather one's nest
to apportion expenses, responsibilities etc/to demand contributions
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
to make extra money
to get money/to accumulate money
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
dirty money
to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/exploitation
to swindle/to defraud
